fields_of_interest: Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: Transport decarbonisation, CO2 regulations for vehicles, Clean Vehicle Directive, DAFI, RED, other mobility and clean energy related activities.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit:
Drive innovation to power a cleaner tomorrow. 
We are inventors, engineers, manufacturers and suppliers of advanced clean-burning fuel systems and components that can change the way the world moves. 
Our technology delivers performance, fuel efficiency and environmental benefits to address the challenges of global climate change and urban air quality. 
We serve our customers in more than 70 countries, primarily for on-road transportation applications.
relevant_communication:
Current activities: 
- Voluntary participation in formal EU public consultations related to e.g CO2 emission monitoring and regulation in the transport sector and renewable energy policy. 
- Participation to EU events such as TEN-T Days (exhibiting). 
- Indirect participation to EU activities through speeches at conferences targeting the EU institutions such as EU funded project events (LNG Blue Corridors conference), NGV industry events (e.g. NGVA Europe, NGV Italy and NGV Global annual events), COP side events and other events to which EU institutions' officials and staff are invited.  
- Indirect participation to EU activities through contribution to preparation of NGVA Europe's and NGV Italy's letters, discussion papers, position papers, presentations and other information material directed and communicated to EU institutions' officials and staff. 
 
In the future, we would be interested in participating in expert groups and/or industry forums such as the Sustainable Transport Forum (STF), activities of the Joint Research Centre (JRC) e.g JEC Well-to-wheels analyses, as well as other meetings with the EU institutions on transport decarbonisation and sustainability topics.
